chargeHist.descr: Registered Sex Offender Intentionally Photograph a Minor without Consent
Registered Sex Offender Intentionally Photograph a Minor without Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryon J Olsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Registered Sex Offender Intentionally Photograph a Minor without Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.14(2)(a).
  • Registered Sex Offender Intentionally Photograph a Minor without Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.14(2)(a).
  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit 75 days if probation is ever revoked

If Extended Supervision / Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

records.addlTxt: discharge regular
Per Court - Civil Judgment to be vacated due to indigence

State by Wertheimer /  Def in person w/o counsel
Hrg by Zoom
CRT:  Def wanted to have Hrg because there was req by DOC to convert CRT costs/fees to civil judgment - what was your position?
Def:  I just don't trust my PO
CRT:  there is something called a Balance Inquiry by DOC - it does have almost $900 worth of pymts you made & some adjustments to your costs - that's why it went from $1580 to $738 & now it's a little bit less - does that sound correct to you?
Def:  yes - comments...
Wertheimer;  State has no position on this
CRT:  obviously def is indigent...he has made a good effort to pay the costs he had - he paid over half - the CRT will VACATE the civil judgment against Mr Olsen on the basis that he's really not capable of earning more than what he's earning right now...CRT WILL VACATE THE CIVIL JUDGMENT ON CRT COSTS/FEES - NOT RESTITUTION
Hearing on July 14, 2021 at 11:00 am.
on Petition for Civil Judgment for CRT Ordered financial obligations in amount of $660.90 e/signed by EML

STATE'S MOTION TO CONSOLIDATE ALL 3 CASES 14CF31, 14CF495 & 14CF497

Def w/atty Locante
Locante; not going to be a plea today
CRT: consolidation motion to be set Mid Jan
Motion hearing on January 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

State by Minser / Def by Atty Tom Locante
MOTION FOR JOINDER
Locante:  I spoke w/ def yesterday, he won't be here today.  This is State's Motion.  Def has indicated he is accepting an offer from State, this should be set for Plea.  He is asking it be set down the road as far as possible - mandatory prison sentence, he has some personal matters to attend to
Minser:  Victims were hoping for fairly speedy resolution to this
CRT:  I don't think the reason for delay is good justification - I am not  inclined to do it
Locante: comments on length of time it took to file def's other charges
CRT:  I can understand that but once a resolution is reached, I think it is approp to try to move it along.  Since I am retiring I will most likely not be here for Sentencing...not sure who will handle it...
Locante comments..
CRT:  I understand - def is looking at very serious charges, mandatory prison..don't know how long this will take.  I assume you want a PSI, that will take at least 30 days.  then the case will have to go through reassignment process - very possible sentencing date may change
Locante:  I have idea - other cases are before EML...
CRT:  I have no problem w/ that if State doesn't object
Minser:  no objection
CRT: you want to schedule plea in front of EML then?
Minse - sure
CRT:  if EML objects, I will take the plea
to Consolidate Cases for Trial
